Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. Look, I get that companies launch products without hashtag#QA all the time. They shouldn't, but they do. And thousands of companies launch hashtag#AI products without considering the impact of hashtag#bias on their systems and users.You might already have thought about use cases like screening out female applicants in hiring, loan algorithms that charge higher rates to Black applicants, or healthcare systems that deprioritize care for disabled people. These aren't theoretical examples. This is already happening. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

Look, I get that companies launch products without hashtag#QA all the time. They shouldn't, but they do. And thousands of companies launch hashtag#AI products without considering the impact of hashtag#bias on their systems and users.You might already have thought about use cases like screening out female applicants in hiring, loan algorithms that charge higher rates to Black applicants, or healthcare systems that deprioritize care for disabled people. These aren't theoretical examples. This is already happening. We desperately need new methods, standards, and accountibility structures to address these ongoing and escalating harms. hashtag#EthicalAI hashtag#BiasInTech hashtag#Accountability

Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. This extension allows more time to address the FGL, which currently prevents children born abroad from inheriting Canadian citizenship if their Canadian parent also acquired citizenship by descent. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA

Sometimes, you outgrow yourself and your startup. Wearing multiple - or even all - the hats? Sales, marketing, project management, testing, product development‚Ä¶ At some point, something‚Äôs gotta give.So, when is the right time to get help?Some warning signs:- You‚Äôre stretched too thin, spending more time working in the business rather than on it strategically.- You‚Äôre missing deadlines - or worse yet, sales calls.- You wake up feeling drained, demotivated or just exhausted.- You‚Äôre not getting enough time for yourself, your family or your friends.Bringing in the right support at the right time can make a HUGE difference between sustainable growth and burnout ü´£Some things I‚Äôve seen from working with startups over the past 7 years:ü´£ Founders pushing themselves to the limit - juggling capital raising, content creation, podcasts, running events, testing and trying to do. it. all. solo. ü´£ Product managers overloaded - stuck between product development, sales and engineering while also handling testing, product roadmap and more.ü´£ CTOs wearing too many hats - coding EVERYTHING, setting the strategic direction, talking to customers ‚Ä¶ all while managing another full-time job.If you‚Äôve ever thought you need more help but worry about breaking your budget, Tekkon might be the right fit.At Tekkon, we help startups scale faster by connecting them with skilled and cost-effective remote tech talent - aka Tekkies.Some of the roles we help hire:üßë‚Äçüíª Full-Stack, Frontend & Backend Developersüë©‚Äçüíª Testers & QA Specialistsüë®‚Äçüíª Project Managersüë®‚Äçüíª Mobile App Developersüë©‚Äçüíª AI/ML Engineersüë©‚Äçüíª Data Analysts, Scientists & Engineersüßë‚Äçüíª DevOpsüë®‚Äçüíª UI/UX Designersüë©‚Äçüíª Cybersecurity SpecialistsExamples of how we‚Äôve helped startups in the past, include:üí° A full-time working CTO built out their entire development team (devs & testers) while using a dedicated project manager as a single point of contact.üí° A busy founder offloaded testing to an experienced tester - giving them back time to focus on growth while setting up better team structures.üí° Multiple startups filled skill gaps in UI/UX, DevOps, AI/ML, frontend development, data engineering and more.Beyond hiring, I‚Äôve personally helped:- Non-tech founders find capable CTOs & tech leaders to help them better understand the tech side of their journey.- Founders connect across my networks in Japan & Australia - opening doors to new partnerships and opportunities.- Business owners find trusted professionals when they needed specific services.So if you need someone to listen, and potentially help you find the right support too, know that I‚Äôm here.Sometimes, stepping back is what helps you move forward.When you‚Äôre ready to breathe again, let‚Äôs talk.

The Ontario Superior Court of Justice has extended the deadline for the federal government to amend the first-generation limit (FGL) on citizenship by descent to April 25, 2025. Look, I get that companies launch products without hashtag#QA all the time. They shouldn't, but they do. And thousands of companies launch hashtag#AI products without considering the impact of hashtag#bias on their systems and users.You might already have thought about use cases like screening out female applicants in hiring, loan algorithms that charge higher rates to Black applicants, or healthcare systems that deprioritize care for disabled people. These aren't theoretical examples. This is already happening. Slow job market and ‚Äòfake news‚Äô resumes are on the rise again.We interviewed few candidates lately for automation and manual QA positions. Each resume came with almost a decade of experience working for big brand applications from across the globe.One automation candidate who had built automation frameworks from scratch using Cypress and JavaScript and created page object model. I asked her to write a simple method that gets an element and then clicks on it. She replied she did not know what a method was but she could write a function instead.In page object model, all pages files are made of methods.I asked two candidates to find an even number from an array. I asked to find odd number from the third candidate. The candidate asked, shouldn‚Äôt I find the even number? ‚Ä¶ you know where I am going with this.One manual QA candidate who had worked for multiple multinationals could not tell what is in a test plan. And then to answer my question about what does a test case include? She started looking left and right. I am not sure how basic can a question be if someone cannot answer that.It is understandable that market is cold right now and people need jobs. But it takes a lot of effort in getting the budget approved for a new position, going through the resumes, preparing questions, doing the interviews and then submitting the feedback. Candidates who try to outsmart the hiring managers by adding fake experience and knowledge may get a temporary opportunity but how can they survive? It is like wasting their own time as well as the time of the hiring teams.Such candidates not only ruin it for themselves and fall in depression after getting rejected again and again but also block paths for those who really and truly qualify.This in my experience is a wave like trend that markets go super hot then super cold. Like cycles. They never stay the same forever.If you are looking for an opportunity but do not have what it takes for a job posting that you are applying for, instead of adding things that you don‚Äôt know. Upskill yourself, start from a position that matches your skill set. Keep on adding knowledge and experience and then sky is the limit.Remember all leaders you see today started from scratch. You can also be one but only by being honest, willing to learn, upskilling yourself and working hard towards it.hashtag#jobs hashtag#QA
